hook.text: You take a 100mg pill but only 40mg reaches your bloodstream. The rest is lost before it can work.

buildup.text: Bioavailability is the percentage of a drug dose that actually reaches the systemic circulation.

discovery.text: IV drugs have 100% bioavailability. Oral drugs vary wildlyâ€”from 5% to over 90% depending on the compound.

twist.text: Food can change bioavailability dramatically. Grapefruit juice blocks an enzyme that breaks down many drugs.

climax.text: That's why some drugs say 'take with food' and others say 'take on an empty stomach'â€”it's about absorption.

punchline.text: What you take matters. How much reaches the blood matters more.

quiz.question: Why does grapefruit juice interact with many medications?
options: It blocks an enzyme that normally breaks down drugs, increasing their levels
It contains chemicals that neutralize most drug compounds
It speeds up liver metabolism of all medications
